etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Schoolcraft (1793–1864). From substantive + -ity

definitions: The strength and robustness of the chemical binding between a dye or pigment and a material to which it is directly applied.
The persistence of effect or retention on the skin, hair, etc., of any topically applied cosmetic or medicinal preparation, as sunscreen, shampoo, etc.
